definition: edge (used directly after a noun, e.g. roadside 馬路沿兒|马路沿儿)
along/to follow (a line, tradition etc)/to carry on/to trim (a border with braid, tape etc)/border/edge
variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc

sentences.english: He stepped off the curb and told me it was secure to cross.
sentences.chinese: 他走下马路沿儿，告诉我现在可以过去了。

sentences.english: He stepped off the curb and told me it was safe to cross .
sentences.chinese: 他走下马路沿儿，告诉我现在可以过去了。

sentences.english: They stand to when an altar son follow son to up dance, carelessly drop to an inside.
sentences.chinese: 它们站到一个坛子沿儿上跳舞时，不小心掉到里面。

definition: side/edge/margin/border/boundary/proximity/thread (of ideas, plots etc)/see also 邊|边[bian1]
erhua variant of 旁邊|旁边[pang2 bian1]
to trim (border with braid, tape etc)
(coll.) to put sth down heavily/to plonk
well bucket/pail made of bamboo strips
